comment:
This does sort of bring up an interesting question that is somewhat related to this. Can you still like an actor's performance from a past movie after said actor has been disgraced? For example, we now know some pretty dark and damning stuff about Kevin Spacey. But does that affect how we can view some of his past performances in films such as "American Beauty" or in "Baby Driver"? Just to name a couple of his more well known films. 

Also, this is probably the most interesting case that involves Hollywood actors and doing things that are clearly wrong. Let me clarify a bit because I probably said that weird. Whenever you hear allegations being brought forth to an actor (like sexual assault) it most likely ends with people now being against that actor. BUT that really isn't the case here. I can't speak to Depp and Heard's relationship, but based on what I have heard it does sound like they are both guilty when it comes to verbal and emotional abuse to some extent. Sometimes people are just in a relationship where neither one of them are the clear cut good or bad guy. They let the other person get in their head and allow themselves to behave and do things that they normally wouldn't do in any other relationship (a comedic fictional example is Ron & Tammy from "Parks & Rec". Obviously fictional and exaggerated, but you get the idea).

But I think this is the only major example where the hate and damnation is aimed not at the one being accused but at the accuser.
